column5: If I bought a new outboard in Canada, what kind of fees would I have to pay to get it back into the states?

On a Yamaha- none! Don't have any experience with other brands. They will not change for either sales tax or duty. Good deal. you will have to stop at Canadian custom's offfice on way out to show you are taking the motor out of the country, thus no sales tax, and at U.S. office to show it is EPA OK.Have fun.Bill K
Here in Niagara Falls, NY the dealers will not work on boats or motors bought in Canada. Thats what I hear, check it out before you buy.

Good idea to check it out but if you buy Honda or Yamaha the warranty is international. Not sure about the others. Dealers get paid to fix warranty issues. I can't see turning away a customer. Lots of this talk is urban legend material.
